posts.title: Build Personal Blog With Hexo and GitHub
posts.text: This article is a step by step instruction on creating a personal website using Hexo framework on GitHub pages with custom domain. What is Hexo?Hexo is a simple yet powerful static blog framework powered by Node.js. Setup and InstallationGitHub Create a GitHub account Create a new repository named <github_username>.github.io Git Install Git Configure your Git username/email Open the Git Bash Set your username:git config --global user.name <github_username> Set your email address:git config --global user.email <github_email> Generate SSH Key and add to GitHub From Git Bash, generate SSH keyssh-keygen -t rsa -C <github_email> Copy the SSH key from the id_rsa.pub file, and paste to GitHub SSH key setting page From Git Bash, check if the setting is successful. ssh git@github.com Node.js Install Node.js From Git Bash, check if Node.js install successfully. node -v Check if npm install successfully. npm -v HexoInstall Hexo with npm npm install -g hexo-cli Start Blogging Initialize the blog in current directory hexo init Create a new article hexo new <title> Edit the markdown file under /source/_posts Generate static file hexo generate Start local server hexo server Check the blog at http://localhost:4000 Change Theme Choose theme Clone the theme to /themes folder git clone <github_repo> Edit the _config.yml file in root directory to use new theme # Extensions ## Plugins: https://hexo.io/plugins/ ## Themes: https://hexo.io/themes/ theme: <theme_name> Follow the instructions on the themeâ€™s Github read me for further setting. Start local server hexo server Check the blog at http://localhost:4000 Deploy GitHub Pages Edit the _config.yml file in root directory deploy: type: git repo: <repository_url> branch: master Install hexo deployer plugin npm install hexo-deployer-git --save Deploy the site hexo clean && hexo generate && hexo deploy Check the blog at http://<github_username>.github.io Front-matter and Other Setting Enable table of contents toc: true Apply categories and tags categories: - <categoriy_name> tags: - <tag_name> Enable read more <!-- more --> Use Custom Domain Backup and Recover Raw Files on GitHub Backup Files git init . git checkout -b hexo # new branch git add . git commit git remote add origin <repository_url> git push --set-upstream origin hexo Recover Files git clone <repository_url> cd <github_username>.github.io/ git checkout hexo npm install hexo server
